task_summary: Locate the fridge handle/edge, align the gripper, grasp, pull to open the hinged door, verify it is open, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile manipulator (PR2) is positioned in front of a small refrigerator. The goal is to open the fridge door. The robot must perceive the door/handle region, align its end-effector with suitable yaw, establish a secure grasp, and pull to swing the hinged door open. Visual confirmation of the opening and a safe retreat complete the task. The workspace is tight near a drawer unit; careful alignment and moderate pulling force are required.
preconditions: Robot in reachable pose in front of the fridge
Perception sensors active with view of door region
stepwise_plan: Check visibility of the handle/edge; otherwise scan the area.
Open gripper and approach while aligning.
Set wrist yaw for side pull, verify orientation.
Close gripper to secure the handle/edge.
Execute door opening for a hinged door.
Confirm door is open and retreat.
success_criteria: Door angle increases visibly and latch disengages
failure_and_recovery: Handle not detected → scanning and retry approach
Door resistance → retry open after slight re-approach
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after ContainerOpen is true and retreat completes.

frame_3.now_evidence: contact and alignment near the door edge are clearly visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: a pull/open action is imminent leading to door swing.

node_specs.description: Checks if the handle/edge is in view.
Active scan to find the handle/edge.
Approach the handle with tight alignment.
Rotate wrist for a lateral pull.
Close gripper to capture the handle/edge.
Check that the door is open.
Back off to a safe pose.

failure_modes: Insufficient pull due to latch friction
recovery_strategy: Re-scan with arc pattern and retry approach (up to 3 times)
Re-open gripper, adjust yaw, and regrasp
Abort if repeated collisions detected and request human help
assumptions: The door is a hinged door opening left-to-right; grasp is on handle or door edge as seen in frames.
No explicit force instructions in text; moderate force chosen (20).
Tight alignment assumed necessary due to narrow handle/edge.

expected_success_criteria: Door visibly swings open and stays open
Robot ends at a safe standoff
